frameDefinitions: An Entity is well-known among a wide range of people (in general or in a particular domain) for a particular Reason, which may be a behavior, characteristic, or some other associated item.
A Perpetrator (generally intentionally) commits a Crime, i.e. does something not permitted by the laws of society.
A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.
This frame describes the Impression which a Figure, which can be a person, an organization, or an object, leaves with an Audience.
This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
frameExamples: Shakespeare was <t>famous</t> during his life because he performed in front of Queen Elizabeth I more than anyone else.
They <t>perpetrated</t> a felony by substituting a lie for negotiations.
It 'll <t>cost</t> Sandra's parents fifty grand a year for her to attend that school.
He had an extremely fragile self - <t><fex name='Impression'>image</fex></t>
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Entity</fen> which is widely known and recognized.
The behavior, attribute, or associated entities that provide the reason for the <fen>Entity</fen> being famous.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is famous.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> is famous.
The individual that commits a <fen>Crime</fen>.
An act, generally intentional, that has been formally forbidden by law.
When the <fen>Crime</fen> was committed.
The location where the <fen>Crime</fen> occurs.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item(s) whose price is being assessed.  <fen>Goods</fen> is usually an External Argument:
The person whose <fen>Asset</fen> is given up in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>.  This role is often expressed as INI.
The price of or payment made for the Goods.
The event that the <fen>Payer</fen> brings about by deploying the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The time when a transaction takes place.
The entity (a person, organization, product, or event) for which the <fen>Audience</fen> has an <fen>Impression</fen>.
A person or group of people who have an <fen>Impression</fen> of a <fen>Figure</fen>.
A generalized conception of a <fen>Figure</fen> presented to or shared by an <fen>Audience</fen>.
<fen>Name</fen> identifies the linguistic expression used to refer to Entities.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is the person the speaker intends to refer to by using a particular name.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
listRoleExamples: This station is famous <fex>for the many ramen shacks surrounding it</fex>.
Certain people are well known <fex>only in North America</fex>.
How can <fex>he</fex> commit treason against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?
How can he commit <fex>treason</fex> against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?
A murder perpetrated <fex>at 1:08AM this morning</fex> was not investigated until noon today.
We have jurisdiction over crimes committed <fex>in Woodside County</fex>.
<fex>These paintings</fex> are very pricey.
A holiday in Europe is very expensive <fex>for me</fex>.
The painting was cheap <fex>at $600</fex>.
<fex>Attending summer school</fex> is expensive.
No, they've got a special on; it's really cheap there <fex>on Tuesdays</fex>
<fex>He</fex> projects a mysterious persona.
His <fex>public</fex> image is flawless
My name is <fex>Bond</fex>.
<fex>You</fex> have an unusual surname.
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Restoring America's Soul: Advancing Timeless Conservative Principles in a Wayward Culture
Called to Stand: How a Small Christian Ministry Courageously Stood Up to Government Tyranny
the hundreds of thousands of dollars
